blocks.value: The Cherubim (singular "Cherub") are the second-highest choir of angels. They are known for their profound knowledge and wisdom. The name "Cherubim" may derive from a word meaning "fullness of knowledge."

Cherubim appear frequently in Scripture. After Adam and Eve's sin, God placed Cherubim with a flaming sword at the entrance to the Garden of Eden (Genesis 3:24). In the Book of Exodus, God commanded that two golden Cherubim be placed on top of the Ark of the Covenant, facing each other with their wings spread over the mercy seat (Exodus 25:18-22).

The prophet Ezekiel saw Cherubim in his visions, describing them as having four faces (man, lion, ox, and eagle) and four wings (Ezekiel 10). The Cherubim guard the holiness of God and contemplate His divine mysteries. They inspire us to seek wisdom and to reverence the sacred.
